posts.post_content:
Too. Good.  
I mean, how come this is not a rare? I ve just come from a draft with one this guy and whenever I pulled it out, it was basically game over! Three mana two three would make a great common flier and with lifelink its just impossible to race. When I attacked with it for the first time I thought "ok, two damage and two life for three mana - this guy has just done enough to justify itself" and then I happily attacked with it for the rest of the game. And deathtouch? Really? Come on. We have a three mana guy that destroys pretty much everything that isnt a Baneslayer angel.   
A nice tournament card, but at uncommon, it crushes any Limited environment. I cant think of any uncommon this powerful, it s stronger than Inceremental Blight, stronger than Shriekmaw, stronger than Rhox War Monk, its just ridiculous.
posts.html:

I mean, how come this is not a rare? I ve just come from a draft with one this guy and whenever I pulled it out, it was basically game over! Three mana two three would make a great common flier and with lifelink its just impossible to race. When I attacked with it for the first time I thought "ok, two damage and two life for three mana - this guy has just done enough to justify itself" and then I happily attacked with it for the rest of the game. And deathtouch? Really? Come on. We have a three mana guy that destroys pretty much everything that isnt a Baneslayer angel.
A nice tournament card, but at uncommon, it crushes any Limited environment. I cant think of any uncommon this powerful, it s stronger than Inceremental Blight, stronger than Shriekmaw, stronger than Rhox War Monk, its just ridiculous.

Posted By: Mightyass (10/12/2009 10:32:31 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Who is not rating this as a 5? I mean, seriously? For 3CC you're getting a flying 2/3 who has lifelink AND deathtouch.
  
   
On top of all of that, as if it wasn't enough, it combos well with other vampires, and it is black so it resists the usual removal from things like [Doomblade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doomblade).
  
   
3 Mana can't be better spent folks.
  
   
5/5, 6/5 if it was possible.
posts.html:

On top of all of that, as if it wasn't enough, it combos well with other vampires, and it is black so it resists the usual removal from things like Doomblade.

3 Mana can't be better spent folks.

5/5, 6/5 if it was possible.

posts.post_content:
This is the best uncommon 3 drop for black ever printed. Power creep indeed! Compared to the other black 3 drop flyers this is by far the stand-out card.
  
   
 A black french vanilla 2/3 with no drawback would be a steal at 3 cmc, so to have one with 2 additional abilities is great, especially when those abilities are Deathtouch and Lifelink. 5 star card. No question.

Posted By: Sironos (5/7/2010 5:15:55 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
An excellent way to hold back aggro, since they won't want to attack into it when it has summoning sickness and it gains you life once you send it on the offense. Vulnerable to almost every popular form of removal in Alara-Zendikar Standard, though... 3 toughness is Bolt-bait, as always.  
  
A little slow for aggro, who might prefer [Arrogant Bloodlord](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Arrogant Bloodlord) and [Gatekeeper of Malakir](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gatekeeper of Malakir) instead.
posts.html:
An excellent way to hold back aggro, since they won't want to attack into it when it has summoning sickness and it gains you life once you send it on the offense. Vulnerable to almost every popular form of removal in Alara-Zendikar Standard, though... 3 toughness is Bolt-bait, as always.

A little slow for aggro, who might prefer Arrogant Bloodlord and Gatekeeper of Malakir instead.

Posted By: jstorrie (5/7/2010 2:47:13 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This is by far one of the most powerful uncommon cards I have seen in a long time, and it can be slightly annoying to have to play against it. But there are many ways to easily deal with this card, from simple things like [Pacify](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pacify) or [Lightning Bolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Bolt) to more desperate moves, such as [Wrath of God](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wrath of God).  
  
@ Mighty\*\*\*: In your posting, are you saying that [Baneslayer Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Baneslayer Angel) would survive due to having first strike or protection from demons? I was just wondering because basically any creature with a toughness of 3 or greater and first strike would survive on defense (but might need more toughness to survive being multi-blocked if attacking). Nighthawk isn't a demon, so I figured you had to be referring to the first strike ability.
posts.html:
